entries.meaning: (surgery) An instrument for scraping the periosteum from bones; a raspatory.

verbs.description: rugine (third-person singular simple present rugines, present participle rugining, simple past and past participle rugined)

entries.meaning: (transitive, surgery) To scrape or rasp (a bone etc.); to scale.
examples: if you do not rugine that away, the Callus will be flow in thrusting out; and if you do rugine it, the deeper you enter into it, the browner and softer the Bone will be.
